resources.string:
1. Identify a star (or the sun) in the sky.
 2. Use Measure feature to record the angle. You may do this by using the shadow your device to line up the angle.
 3. Either Manually or by using the Rotate feature, turn the rete so that today's date aligns on the altitude circle corresponding to the angle measured.
 4. Align a rule from the centre to the same date, and measure the time.

- Map Coordinates of Major stars onto Astrolabe Rete.
 - Automate Rotation of Astrolabe (promped).
 - Implement Rule to measure time.
 - Implement a zoom function, as plate + rete are quite small and hard to see. Also considering colour changes. - Implement back side of Astrolabe, which is crucial as it contains the date time.
